snippet: Some believe that two outside reports that concluded a Cleveland officer was “reasonable” in deciding to shoot 12-year-old Tamir Rice signaled that an indictment was unlikely.
abstract: Cuyahoga County, Ohio, prosecutor's office releases commissioned reports intimating that former Cleveland Police Officer Tim Loehmann, who fatally shot 12-year-old Tamir Rice in 2014, will remain free; investigation will continue and grand jury will ultimately decide on charges, but some believe reports signal indictment is unlikely; lawyers for family and area activists criticize investigation's length, and question objectivity of prosecutor's office.
lead_paragraph: Some believe that two outside reports that concluded a Cleveland officer was “reasonable” in deciding to shoot 12-year-old Tamir Rice signaled that an indictment was unlikely.

headline.print_headline: Reviews Seen as Portent of No Charges in Police Shooting of a Cleveland Boy
headline.main: Two Reviews of Tamir Rice Shooting in Cleveland Are Seen as Shielding Police
